ASP0014.shortDescription: Suggest using top level route registrations

CA1050.shortDescription: Declarar tipos en espacios de nombres
CA1050.fullDescription: Los tipos se declaran en los espacios de nombres para evitar conflictos de nombre y como forma de organizar los tipos relacionados en una jerarqu√≠a de objetos.

CA1822.fullDescription: Los miembros que no tienen acceso a datos de instancia o que llaman a m√©todos de instancia se pueden marcar como static. Despu√©s de marcar los m√©todos como static, el compilador emitir√° los sitios de llamada no virtuales para estos miembros. Esto puede proporcionar una mejora apreciable del rendimiento del c√≥digo sensible al rendimiento.

CA1859.shortDescription: Usar tipos concretos cuando sea posible para mejorar el rendimiento
CA1859.fullDescription: El uso de tipos concretos evita la sobrecarga de llamadas virtuales o de interfaz y habilita la inserci√≥n.

CA1860.shortDescription: Evitar usar el m√©todo de extensi√≥n "Enumerable.Any()"
CA1860.fullDescription: Es preferible usar las propiedades "IsEmpty", "Count" o "Length", si hay alguna disponible, en lugar de llamar a "Enumerable.Any()". La intenci√≥n es m√°s clara y tiene un mejor rendimiento que usar el m√©todo de extensi√≥n "Enumerable.Any()".

CS8602.shortDescription: Desreferencia de una referencia posiblemente NULL.

CS8618.shortDescription: Un campo que no acepta valores NULL debe contener un valor distinto de NULL al salir del constructor. Considere la posibilidad de agregar el modificador "required" o declararlo como un valor que acepta valores NULL.

CS8622.shortDescription: La nulabilidad de los tipos de referencia del tipo de par√°metro no coincide con el delegado de destino (posiblemente debido a los atributos de nulabilidad).

S125.shortDescription: Sections of code should not be commented out
S125.fullDescription: Commented-out code distracts the focus from the actual executed code. It creates a noise that increases maintenance code. And because it is never executed, it quickly becomes out of date and invalid.

S2068.fullDescription: Because it is easy to extract strings from an application source code or binary, credentials should not be hard-coded. This is particularly true for applications that are distributed or that are open-source.

S2325.shortDescription: Methods and properties that don't access instance data should be static
S2325.fullDescription: Methods and properties that don‚Äôt access instance data should be marked as static for the following reasons:

S2696.shortDescription: Instance members should not write to "static" fields
S2696.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue each time a static field is updated from a non-static method or property.

S3010.shortDescription: Static fields should not be updated in constructors
S3010.fullDescription: Assigning a value to a static field in a constructor could cause unreliable behavior at runtime since it will change the value for all instances of the class.

S3776.shortDescription: Cognitive Complexity of methods should not be too high
S3776.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when the code cognitive complexity of a function is above a certain threshold.

S3903.shortDescription: Types should be defined in named namespaces
S3903.fullDescription: Types are declared in namespaces in order to prevent name collisions and as a way to organize them into the object hierarchy. Types that are defined outside any named namespace are in a global namespace that cannot be referenced in code.

S4487.fullDescription: Private fields which are written but never read are a case of "dead store". Changing the value of such a field is useless and most probably indicates an error in the code.

S6444.shortDescription: Not specifying a timeout for regular expressions is security-sensitive
S6444.fullDescription: Not specifying a timeout for regular expressions can lead to a Denial-of-Service attack. Pass a timeout when using System.Text.RegularExpressions to process untrusted input because a malicious user might craft a value for which the evaluation lasts excessively long.

S6934.shortDescription: A Route attribute should be added to the controller when a route template is specified at the action level
S6934.fullDescription: When a route template is defined through an attribute on an action method, conventional routing for that action is disabled. To maintain good practice, it‚Äôs recommended not to combine conventional and attribute-based routing within a single controller to avoid unpredicted behavior. As such, the controller should exclude itself from conventional routing by applying a [Route] attribute.

S6961.shortDescription: API Controllers should derive from ControllerBase instead of Controller
S6961.fullDescription: In ASP.NET Core, controllers usually inherit either from ControllerBase or Controller. If a controller does not use any View-specific functionality, it is recommended to inherit from ControllerBase.

S6964.shortDescription: Value type property used as input in a controller action should be nullable, required or annotated with the JsonRequiredAttribute to avoid under-posting.
S6964.fullDescription: "Under-posting" refers to a situation where a client sends less data than expected to the server during an HTTP request, for example when the client omits some properties from the request body that the server expects to receive.

S6966.fullDescription: In an async method, any blocking operations should be avoided.
